DOC.brief_summary: 250 Acute on chronic liver failure patients with HVPG (Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient) > 12 mmHg + No/small esophageal varices who present to the Department of Hepatology at Institute of Liver and Billiary Sciences, who meet the inclusion criteria and who provide informed consent.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Nonselective Beta Blocker vs Placebo in Patients With Acute-on-chronic Liver Failure With Small/ no Esophageal Varices
DOC.criteria: 1. Acute on Chronic Liver Failure as per APASL (Asian Pacific Association of Study of Liver Disease) criteria. 2. 1875 years 3. HVPG > 12 + No/Small Esophageal varices 1. Bradycardia (HR < 60/ min) 2. Hypotension 3. Asthma 4. LVF 5. AKI (Acute Kidney Injury) 6. Refractory ascites 7. SBP (Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis)
